    <item>
      <title>Emissions increases approved by regulator may wipe out $260m of Direct Action cuts</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/19/emissions-increases-approved-by-regulator-may-wipe-out-260m-of-direct-action-cuts</link>
      <description><p><strong>Exclusive: </strong>Nearly 60 industrial sites get green light to increase emissions, cancelling out cuts paid for by Coalition using public money</p><p>Nearly 60 Australian industrial sites have been given the green light to increase greenhouse gas pollution, potentially cancelling out hundreds of millions of dollars of public spending on emissions cuts under the Coalition’s Direct Action climate policy.</p><p>The increases have been <a href="http://www.cleanenergyregulator.gov.au/NGER/Pages/News%20and%20updates/NewsItem.aspx?ListId=19b4efbb-6f5d-4637-94c4-121c1f96fcfe&amp;ItemId=469">quietly approved under the “safeguard mechanism”</a>, which was introduced as part of Direct Action to ensure cuts paid for using the main part of the policy – the emission reduction fund – were not undone by emissions increasing in other parts of the economy.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/electricity-retailers-could-defer-emissions-reductions-under-coalition-plan">Electricity retailers could defer emissions reductions under Coalition plan</a> </p><p>Emissions growth is outpacing the abatement from the emissions reduction fund, so what has been the point?</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/dec/31/a-great-year-for-clean-energy-in-australia-ends-while-bad-news-for-coal-continues">A great year for clean energy in Australia ends, while bad news for coal continues | Simon Holmes à Court</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2017/dec/19/coalitions-climate-policy-review-reveals-it-will-loosen-pollution-safeguard">Coalition's climate policy review reveals it will loosen pollution safeguard</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/19/emissions-increases-approved-by-regulator-may-wipe-out-260m-of-direct-action-cuts">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>Malcolm Turnbull consulted his wife, Lucy, over minister-staff sex ban</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/malcolm-turnbull-consulted-his-wife-lucy-over-minister-staff-sex-ban</link>
      <description><p>PM says his criticism of Barnaby Joyce ‘would have overwhelming endorsement of Australians’</p><p>The ministerial sex ban <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/malcolm-turnbull">Malcolm Turnbull </a>imposed on his government was “one of those classic issues” where he sought the counsel of his wife, Lucy, the prime minister has revealed.</p><p>In an interview for 60 minutes, Turnbull maintained he <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/turnbull-says-he-has-nothing-to-apologise-for-over-barnaby-joyce-row">had no regrets</a> about the public flaying he gave his deputy, Barnaby Joyce, over his affair with a former staffer. Turnbull said he spoke for the nation despite his now-infamous comments that threatened to tear the Coalition apart.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/turnbull-says-he-has-nothing-to-apologise-for-over-barnaby-joyce-row">Turnbull says he has 'nothing to apologise for' over Barnaby Joyce row</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyces-sex-life-dissected-but-integrity-and-accountability-questions-remain">Barnaby Joyce’s sex life dissected, but integrity and accountability questions remain | Katharine Murphy</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/malcolm-turnbull-consulted-his-wife-lucy-over-minister-staff-sex-ban">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>George Christensen reported to police over gun photo aimed at 'greenie' rivals</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/george-christensen-reported-to-police-over-gun-photo-aimed-at-greenie-rivals</link>
      <description><p>Screenshot from Queensland LNP politician’s Facebook page is sent to police by Greens candidate Ben Pennings who said he received death threats</p><p>The Queensland LNP politician George Christensen has been referred to police over a Facebook post showing the MP holding a handgun and the comment “Do you feel lucky, greenie punks?”<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/feb/15/florida-shooting-suspect-charged-questions-nikolas-cruz"> </a></p><p>Ben Pennings, who is running for the lead <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/jan/05/larissa-waters-faces-tough-internal-challenge-for-greens-spot-in-senate">position on the Queensland Greens Senate ticket</a>, said he sent police the screenshot of Christensen’s post after receiving “numerous” death threats from central and north Queensland.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/labor-shouldnt-toughen-its-stance-on-adani-coalmine-cfmeu-head-warns">Labor shouldn't toughen its stance on Adani coalmine, CFMEU head warns</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/turnbull-says-he-has-nothing-to-apologise-for-over-barnaby-joyce-row">Turnbull says he has 'nothing to apologise for' over Barnaby Joyce row</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/george-christensen-reported-to-police-over-gun-photo-aimed-at-greenie-rivals">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>Turnbull says he has 'nothing to apologise for' over Barnaby Joyce row</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/turnbull-says-he-has-nothing-to-apologise-for-over-barnaby-joyce-row</link>
      <description><p>PM says two men had a ‘frank discussion’ on Saturday and describes relationship with Nationals as an ‘enduring alliance’</p><p>Malcolm Turnbull has “nothing to apologise for” in regards to Barnaby Joyce, the prime minister has said, describing the meeting he held with his deputy in the same terms as his now-infamous first phone call with Donald Trump.</p><p>The leaders of the Liberal and National coalition parties <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/17/tony-abbott-wades-into-turnbull-joyce-row-as-coalition-splits-widen">met on Saturday,</a> without their staff, to hash out their differences after a public war of words that saw Turnbull<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/australia-bans-ministers-having-sex-with-staff-barnaby-joyce-malcolm-turnbull"> question his deputy’s moral character</a>, advising him to “reflect” on his position, and Joyce hit back calling the prime minister <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">“inept”</a>.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/sleeping-with-your-staff-is-bad-practice-says-scott-morrisson">Sleeping with your staff is bad practice, says Scott Morrison</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyces-sex-life-dissected-but-integrity-and-accountability-questions-remain">Barnaby Joyce’s sex life dissected, but integrity and accountability questions remain | Katharine Murphy</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/turnbull-says-he-has-nothing-to-apologise-for-over-barnaby-joyce-row">Continue reading...</a></description>

        <media:credit scheme="urn:ebu">Photograph: David Crosling/AAP</media:credit>
      </media:content>

    <item>
      <title>Sleeping with your staff is bad practice, says Scott Morrison</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/sleeping-with-your-staff-is-bad-practice-says-scott-morrisson</link>
      <description><p>Treasurer plays down rift between Turnbull and Joyce and says the pair’s meeting on Saturday shows they can have frank conversations</p><p>Malcolm Turnbull stands by his condemnation of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/barnaby-joyce">Barnaby Joyce’s</a> actions, and Scott Morrison agrees with him – while both have claimed everything is fine with the Coalition partnership despite the “forceful” nature of the prime minister’s comments.</p><p>Morrison was sent out on Sunday to assure voters that all was well, while quibbling over whether the prime minister had ever advised Joyce to step down.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/feb/16/malcolm-turnbull-does-the-time-warp-with-his-ministerial-sex-ban">Malcolm Turnbull does the time warp with his ministerial sex ban | Gay Alcorn</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/18/sleeping-with-your-staff-is-bad-practice-says-scott-morrisson">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>Turnbull, Fifield and Morrison wrote to ABC boss before tax cut analysis was removed</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/turnbull-fifield-and-morrison-wrote-to-abc-boss-before-tax-cut-analysis-was-removed-report</link>
      <description><p>Broadcaster insists outside pressure did not affect decision despite concerted criticisms of the piece by the government</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/malcolm-turnbull">Malcolm Turnbull</a>, his communications minister and the treasurer all wrote to Michelle Guthrie to complain about coverage of corporate tax policy by Emma Alberici before the ABC removed the contentious piece on Thursday.<br></p><p>The letter from the communications minister, Mitch Fifield, is quoted in the Weekend Australian, which also reports the prime minister and the treasurer, Scott Morrison, wrote to the ABC boss.<br></p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/lot-of-disquiet-senior-abc-staff-angry-over-return-of-cabinet-files">'Lot of disquiet': senior ABC staff angry over return of cabinet files</a> </p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Turnbull is in parliament attacking the ABC for telling the truth about his $65 billion handout for multinationals. Here’s the full story. <a href="https://t.co/IEY3ZN8GAD">https://t.co/IEY3ZN8GAD</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">I won’t use Twitter to provide a detailed analysis of anyone’s reporting, other than to say that Uhlmann, Ross, Alberici and many others are all great journos. But none of us are perfect or beyond criticism, and we all have to fit into the high editorial standards of the ABC.</p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">How do you feel <a href="https://twitter.com/albericie?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@albericie</a> having your excellent investigative journalism on Company Tax Cuts DELETED from the <a href="https://twitter.com/abcnews?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@abcnews</a> website? <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspol?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspol</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/abc730?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#abc730</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/thedrum?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#thedrum</a> <a href="https://t.co/WI3oS2q2aS">pic.twitter.com/WI3oS2q2aS</a></p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/turnbull-fifield-and-morrison-wrote-to-abc-boss-before-tax-cut-analysis-was-removed-report">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/media/australia-media">Australian media</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/australia-news">Australia news</category>

      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/malcolm-turnbull">Malcolm Turnbull</category>

      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/tax-australia">Tax</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/business/australia-economy">Australian economy</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/coalition">Coalition</category>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 05:49:18 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/turnbull-fifield-and-morrison-wrote-to-abc-boss-before-tax-cut-analysis-was-removed-report</guid>
      <media:content width="140" url="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/2b3611cb5e41d85d3b9334b95cfd553fa4437deb/89_0_1778_1067/master/1778.jpg?w=140&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&fit=max&s=1e7f13ee5edf1ada5e5cdb81d5fe3b9b">
        <media:credit scheme="urn:ebu">Photograph: ABC</media:credit>

      <title>Malcolm Turnbull and Barnaby Joyce meet to resolve row</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/17/tony-abbott-wades-into-turnbull-joyce-row-as-coalition-splits-widen</link>
      <description><p>Attempt to defuse tension comes as Liberal senator Ian Macdonald tells ABC Joyce should resign to the backbench</p><p>Barnaby Joyce and Malcolm Turnbull have met face-to-face in Sydney in an attempt to resolve the damaging public crisis engulfing the Coalition. </p><p>The pair are understood to have met about midday for more than an hour. </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/as-joyce-and-turnbull-slug-it-out-twitter-takes-a-ringside-seat-ding-ding-ding">As Joyce and Turnbull slug it out, Twitter takes a ringside seat. Ding ding ding!</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyces-sex-life-dissected-but-integrity-and-accountability-questions-remain">Barnaby Joyce’s sex life dissected, but integrity and accountability questions remain | Katharine Murphy</a> </p><p></p><p>Barnaby Joyce is not a member of Malcolm Turnbull's Liberal party, he is the leader of the National party, which governs in coalition with the Liberals. In the same way that the prime minister could not sack the leader of the Labor party, he has no power to force the Nationals to change their leader.&nbsp;</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/its-open-season-on-malcolm-turnbull-seething-joyce-supporters-say">It's 'open season’ on Malcolm Turnbull, seething Joyce supporters say</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/17/tony-abbott-wades-into-turnbull-joyce-row-as-coalition-splits-widen">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>No record of some threatened species in area government says it's protecting them</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/feb/17/no-record-of-some-threatened-species-in-area-government-says-its-protecting-them</link>
      <description><p>Experts say growling grass frog and southern brown bandicoot not likely to be found at Endeavour Fern Gully<br></p><p>Experts have cast doubt on government claims the Coalition is funding a conservation project in Victoria’s Endeavour Fern Gully to benefit threatened species – because the listed species are unlikely to occur in the area. </p><p>Endeavour Fern Gully is a 27-hectare (65 acre) rainforest property on the Mornington Peninsula<em>. </em>The environment and energy minister, Josh Frydenberg, says the government had funded a broad Green Army project<em> </em>that “improves habitat through weed control and promotes greater conservation awareness of native vegetation in remnant bushland at Endeavour Fern Gully”.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/feb/15/nothing-to-do-with-threatened-species-coalition-accused-of-overstating-spending">'Nothing to do with threatened species': Coalition accused of overstating spending</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/feb/14/incongruous-species-funding-in-the-most-unlikely-places">‘Absolute scandal’: how does restoring a ship help endangered species?</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/feb/13/a-national-disgrace-australias-extinction-crisis-is-unfolding-in-plain-sight">'A national disgrace': Australia's extinction crisis is unfolding in plain sight</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/feb/17/no-record-of-some-threatened-species-in-area-government-says-its-protecting-them">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>Barnaby Joyce’s sex life dissected, but integrity and accountability questions remain | Katharine Murphy</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyces-sex-life-dissected-but-integrity-and-accountability-questions-remain</link>
      <description><p>Tony Abbott rails against anti-corruption body, Murray-Darling plan close to collapse, but sex-ban gets headlines</p><p>While the parliament and its entourage rode the rollercoaster of Barnaby Joyce’s sex life, and the two men running Australia <a draggable="true" href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">declared open warfare on one another</a>, the bigger systemic issues lurking behind the whole saga sat more or less undisturbed.<br tabindex="-1"></p><p>Labor launched an inquisition about various alleged conflicts of interest, and alleged non-compliance with ministerial standards, but Malcolm Turnbull stood like the duty solicitor for legal aid at the dispatch box, parsing and objecting – everyone being entitled to a defence, even a colleague whom he would later characterise <a draggable="true" href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/australia-bans-ministers-having-sex-with-staff-barnaby-joyce-malcolm-turnbull">in visceral terms</a> as morally flawed.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/turnbulls-sex-ban-has-thrown-petrol-on-a-political-bonfire">Turnbull's sex ban has thrown petrol on a political bonfire | Katharine Murphy</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">Barnaby Joyce throws Coalition into crisis over PM's 'inept and unnecessary' attack</a> </p><p></p><p>Barnaby Joyce is not a member of Malcolm Turnbull's Liberal party, he is the leader of the National party, which governs in coalition with the Liberals. In the same way that the prime minister could not sack the leader of the Labor party, he has no power to force the Nationals to change their leader.&nbsp;</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/14/not-one-rule-breaking-political-lobbyist-suspended-in-five-years-audit-finds">Not one rule-breaking political lobbyist suspended in five years, audit finds</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyces-sex-life-dissected-but-integrity-and-accountability-questions-remain">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <title>'Lot of disquiet': senior ABC staff angry over return of cabinet files</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/lot-of-disquiet-senior-abc-staff-angry-over-return-of-cabinet-files</link>
      <description><p>Management took conservative approach rather than getting good stories, journalists say</p><p>Senior journalists at the ABC have told of their anger at the handling of the “Cabinet Files” by the corporation’s management and in particular the decision to hand the trove of documents back to the government.</p><p> The Cabinet Files was <a href="http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-01-31/cabinet-files-reveal-inner-government-decisions/9168442">the publication of nine news stories in January</a>, which were sourced from a cache of cabinet documents obtained by the ABC after they were found in a filing cabinet in a second-hand shop in Canberra. “Hundreds of top-secret and highly classified cabinet documents have been obtained by the ABC following an extraordinary breach of national security,” the broadcaster said in its original reporting. </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/02/abc-agrees-to-return-secret-documents-found-in-old-filing-cabinets">ABC agrees to return secret documents found in old filing cabinets</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/feb/16/qas-metoo-show-failed-to-answer-the-question-why-was-it-on-at-all">Q&amp;A's #MeToo show failed to answer the question: why was it on at all? | Gabrielle Jackson</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/09/abc-now-costs-each-australian-four-cents-a-day-half-of-what-it-did-30-years-ago">ABC now costs each Australian four cents a day – half of what it did 30 years ago</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/12/laura-tingle-joins-abc-as-730s-chief-political-correspondent">Laura Tingle joins ABC as 7.30's chief political correspondent</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/17/lot-of-disquiet-senior-abc-staff-angry-over-return-of-cabinet-files">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <title>ABC removes corporate tax cut analysis after complaints from Malcolm Turnbull</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/16/abc-removes-corporate-tax-cut-analysis-after-complaints-from-malcolm-turnbull</link>
      <description><p>Broadcaster says Emma Alberici piece removed because it did not meet editorial standards</p><p>After complaints from Malcolm Turnbull, ABC News has removed an analysis piece about the government’s proposed corporate tax cuts by economics correspondent Emma Alberici.<br></p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/16/the-gift-that-keeps-on-giving-10-joyce-splashes-in-a-row-at-the-tele">The gift that keeps on giving: 10 Joyce splashes in a row at the Tele | The Weekly Beast</a> </p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">In QT the PM tore into <a href="https://twitter.com/albericie?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@albericie</a> for her analysis that there is little case for corporate tax cuts. He’s ignored similar pieces by <a href="https://twitter.com/MichaelWestBiz?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@MichaelWestBiz</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/Adam_Creighton?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@Adam_Creighton</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/StephenLongAus?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@StephenLongAus</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/1petermartin?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@1petermartin</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/BernardKeane?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@BernardKeane</a> <br><br>Draw your own conclusions.</p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">In 2001 I was a <a href="https://twitter.com/walkleys?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@walkleys</a> finalist for a story on tax minimisation <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/justsaying?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#justsaying</a></p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/media/2018/feb/16/abc-removes-corporate-tax-cut-analysis-after-complaints-from-malcolm-turnbull">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <title>Turnbull's criticism has ensured Joyce stays, Nationals MPs say</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/turnbulls-criticism-has-ensured-joyce-stays-nationals-mps-say</link>
      <description><p>Liberal MP Kevin Andrews says the leaders should cease public commentary and sort things out</p><p>Malcolm Turnbull has ensured <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/barnaby-joyce">Barnaby Joyce</a> will “never be shifted” as Nationals leader and his position has “cemented”, say supporters rallying around the deputy prime minister.</p><p>As the prime minister attempted to calm tempers by walking back <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/australia-bans-ministers-having-sex-with-staff-barnaby-joyce-malcolm-turnbull">some of his comments </a> on Joyce, publicly declaring he had not “sought in any way to influence the deliberations in the National party” or “made any criticism of the National party”, he stood by his criticism of the Nationals leader’s behaviour in having an extramarital affair.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/australian-political-feuds-five-of-the-biggest-bust-ups">Australian political feuds: five of the biggest bust-ups</a> </p><p></p><p>Barnaby Joyce is not a member of Malcolm Turnbull's Liberal party, he is the leader of the National party, which governs in coalition with the Liberals. In the same way that the prime minister could not sack the leader of the Labor party, he has no power to force the Nationals to change their leader.&nbsp;</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/as-joyce-and-turnbull-slug-it-out-twitter-takes-a-ringside-seat-ding-ding-ding">As Joyce and Turnbull slug it out, Twitter takes a ringside seat. Ding ding ding!</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/what-joyce-said-about-turnbull-the-coalition-and-his-leadership-full-transcript">What Joyce said about Turnbull, the Coalition and his leadership – full transcript</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/turnbulls-criticism-has-ensured-joyce-stays-nationals-mps-say">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <title>Admiral warns US must prepare for possibility of war with China</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/feb/16/admiral-warns-us-must-prepare-for-possibility-of-war-with-china</link>
      <description><p>Harry Harris, the next US ambassador to Australia, says Beijing intends to control South China Sea</p><p>The <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/10/admiral-harry-harris-named-us-ambassador-to-australia">navy admiral nominated to be the next US ambassador to Australia</a> has told Congress America must prepare for the possibility of war with China, and said it would rely on Australia to help uphold the international rules-based system in the Asia-Pacific.</p><p>In an excoriating assessment of China’s increasingly muscular posture in the region, Harry Harris said Beijing’s “intent is crystal clear” to dominate the South China Sea and that its military might could soon rival American power “across almost every domain”. </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/10/admiral-harry-harris-named-us-ambassador-to-australia">Admiral Harry Harris named US ambassador to Australia</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/jul/12/south-china-sea-dispute-what-you-need-to-know-about-the-hague-court-ruling">South China Sea dispute: what you need to know about The Hague court ruling</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/feb/16/admiral-warns-us-must-prepare-for-possibility-of-war-with-china">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/liberal-mp-caught-on-open-mic-using-four-letter-word-on-murray-darling-plan</link>
      <description><p>Tony Pasin tells Murray-Darling Basin Authority’s Phillip Glyde the plan took 100 years to make but ‘one night to fuck it up’</p><p>A government MP has been caught joking with the head of the Murray-Darling Basin Authority about who’s had a worse week, before quipping that the basin plan took 100 years to make but “one night to fuck it up”.</p><p>Microphones picked up the conversation between Liberal MP Tony Pasin and the chief executive of the MDBA, Phillip Glyde, just before Glyde was due to give evidence to a Senate inquiry into regional development and decentralisation in Canberra.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">Barnaby Joyce throws Coalition into crisis over PM's 'inept and unnecessary' attack</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/murray-darling-water-plan-is-over-says-victoria">Murray-Darling water plan: NSW blames 'politicking' for decision to walk away</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/liberal-mp-caught-on-open-mic-using-four-letter-word-on-murray-darling-plan">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>As Joyce and Turnbull  slug it out, Twitter takes a ringside seat. Ding ding ding!</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/as-joyce-and-turnbull-slug-it-out-twitter-takes-a-ringside-seat-ding-ding-ding</link>
      <description><p>In the blue corner we have Australia’s PM, in the green corner his deputy … Can either land a knockout blow?</p><p>It’s the match Twitter’s been waiting for! Tensions between Malcolm Turnbull and Barnaby Joyce over the deputy prime minister’s affair with a staffer have finally <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">exploded in a series of fiery press conferences</a> … and the gloves came off.<br></p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/australian-political-feuds-five-of-the-biggest-bust-ups">Australian political feuds: five of the biggest bust-ups</a> </p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">New signs already in place at Australian Parliament House: <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/bonkban?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#bonkban</a> <a href="https://t.co/TsZxc99a1G">pic.twitter.com/TsZxc99a1G</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Our political discourse is a sheer vacuum of grandeur or dignity. I kind of love it. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/BonkBan?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#BonkBan</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">And so with the bonking ban, begins SEXIT. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspol?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspol</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Well then. I never thought we'd see another open war after the Rudd-Gillard-Rudd years. Extraordinary.</p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">exclusive vision of the Liberals and Nationals squaring off right now: <a href="https://t.co/QsRHW499jn">pic.twitter.com/QsRHW499jn</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Just gonna leave this here <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspol?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspol</a> <a href="https://t.co/2cs9AlmbIA">pic.twitter.com/2cs9AlmbIA</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">THAT press conference in just two letters: F. U. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspol?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspol</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspolbarnaby?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspolbarnaby</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">I hope Turnbull and Joyce settle this issue the only way men can, by cage fighting in their underpants.</p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">ICYMI, here's a brief recap of Barnaby Joyce's news conference: <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspolbarnaby?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspolbarnaby</a> <a href="https://t.co/ol1au9QIAI">pic.twitter.com/ol1au9QIAI</a></p><p lang="en" dir="ltr">How quickly relationships change. Only 2 months ago they were madly in love. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/auspolbarnaby?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#auspolbarnaby</a> <a href="https://t.co/cpBgoJOl4i">pic.twitter.com/cpBgoJOl4i</a></p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/as-joyce-and-turnbull-slug-it-out-twitter-takes-a-ringside-seat-ding-ding-ding">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <media:content width="140" url="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/4f9d480d4d09b3ad026250caac43bdd59e3f028d/128_297_4757_2854/master/4757.jpg?w=140&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&fit=max&s=32e18debe9c84251fb801947d6292b7c">
        <media:credit scheme="urn:ebu">Photograph: piyathep/Getty Images/iStockphoto</media:credit>

      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/australian-political-feuds-five-of-the-biggest-bust-ups</link>
      <description><p>As Turnbull and Joyce trade blows, the Guardian looks back at stoushes that toppled leaders on both sides of the house</p><p>When <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2015/sep/14/australian-leader-tony-abbott-ousted-by-malcolm-turnbull-after-mps-vote">Malcolm Turnbull ousted Tony Abbott</a> from the Liberal party leadership in 2015, it was part two of a feud between the two men. In 2009 Abbott had ousted Turnbull as party leader by just one vote in a contest mostly about whether the Liberals should back Labor’s carbon pollution reduction scheme. Turnbull was in favour, Abbott against. Abbott’s subsequent “axe the tax” campaign helped to topple Julia Gillard.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/australian-political-feuds-five-of-the-biggest-bust-ups">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <title>What Joyce said about Turnbull, the Coalition and his leadership – full transcript</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/what-joyce-said-about-turnbull-the-coalition-and-his-leadership-full-transcript</link>
      <description><p>This is the full text of deputy prime minister Barnaby Joyce’s speech <br><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/barnaby-joyce-lashes-out-at-turnbull-for-inept-and-damaging-comments-on-his-marriage">• Barnaby Joyce throws Coalition into crisis over Turnbull’s ‘inept and damaging’ comments</a></p><p> I would like to start with the comments that that I’ve made to other media units but I’ll make them again.</p><p>I am incredibly sorry for the hurt that I’ve caused Natalie, my daughters and Vikki since my marriage break up last year. I say that again I am incredibly sorry and apologise to the people of New England but appreciate their immense support that I have received, immense support.</p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/what-turnbull-said-about-joyce-and-the-code-of-conduct-changes-full-transcript">What Turnbull said about Joyce and the code of conduct changes – full transcript</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/turnbulls-sex-ban-has-thrown-petrol-on-a-political-bonfire">Turnbull's sex ban has thrown petrol on a political bonfire | Katharine Murphy</a> </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/15/australia-bans-ministers-having-sex-with-staff-barnaby-joyce-malcolm-turnbull">Australia bans ministers from having sex with staff after Barnaby Joyce scandal</a> </p><p></p><p>Barnaby Joyce is not a member of Malcolm Turnbull's Liberal party, he is the leader of the National party, which governs in coalition with the Liberals. In the same way that the prime minister could not sack the leader of the Labor party, he has no power to force the Nationals to change their leader.&nbsp;</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/what-joyce-said-about-turnbull-the-coalition-and-his-leadership-full-transcript">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <title>Child sexual abuse redress scheme 'creates deserving and undeserving survivors'</title>
      <link>https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/child-sexual-abuse-redress-scheme-creates-deserving-and-undeserving-survivors</link>
      <description><p>Sex assault counsellors tell Senate inquiry that convicted criminals should not be excluded from compensation</p><p>Sexual assault counsellors have warned that the government’s national redress scheme risks creating classes of “deserving” and “undeserving” survivors of child sexual abuse.<br></p><p>The government plans to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/jan/31/plea-for-criminals-who-were-victims-of-child-sexual-abuse-to-access-redress-scheme">prevent people convicted of serious crimes</a> from accessing compensation for past child sexual abuse through the proposed redress scheme which is before parliament. </p><p> <span>Related: </span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/jan/31/plea-for-criminals-who-were-victims-of-child-sexual-abuse-to-access-redress-scheme">Plea for criminals who were victims of child sexual abuse to access redress scheme</a> </p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/child-sexual-abuse-redress-scheme-creates-deserving-and-undeserving-survivors">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/royal-commission-into-institutional-responses-to-child-sexual-abuse">Royal commission into institutional responses to child sexual abuse</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/australia-news">Australia news</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/australian-politics">Australian politics</category>
      <category domain="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/coalition">Coalition</category>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 02:03:04 GMT</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/feb/16/child-sexual-abuse-redress-scheme-creates-deserving-and-undeserving-survivors</guid>
      <media:content width="140" url="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/8ee47ecbd06f3c2c7f291973ed14903eb51cf3f8/0_134_3872_2324/master/3872.jpg?w=140&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&fit=max&s=2f8eb83572b55e774ae947617f12f9a6">
        <media:credit scheme="urn:ebu">Photograph: Veryan Dale/Alamy Stock Photo</media:credit>
      </media:content>
      <media:content width="460" url="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/8ee47ecbd06f3c2c7f291973ed14903eb51cf3f8/0_134_3872_2324/master/3872.jpg?w=460&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&fit=max&s=704b41f86f1449d31b49412b3901f131">
